section.p: With semantic specialization you can increase the power of XSLT-Conrefs in the following ways:

refbody.section: Evaluating DITA ContentWhen using standard DITA content as input source for your XSLT script you will probably have difficulties interpreting it to reliably create some useful overviews from it. By using fine-granular semantic specialization you can give more easily give domain specific meaning to the content.

Creating Specialized XSLT-Conref ElementsSince the complete interface of XSLT-Conref is consists of attributes you can provide default values all aspects by the schema to hide the complexity of content reuse from the author. For instance, you can define mandatory XSLT-Conref elements by the schema in such a way that the author doesn't have to manually insert any XSLT-Conref element or edit any related attribute and still see the result of it.
